rundown: 3-9 L vs Pittsburgh Pirates Joey Wentz: 4.0 innings, 4 earned runs, 8 hits, 1 HR, 3 strikeouts Batters: Michael Harris II (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Matt Olson (1 hit - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Drake Baldwin (1 hit - 3 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell to the Pittsburgh Pirates with a final score of 3-9. The loss was attributed to a rough outing from the starting pitcher, Joey Wentz, who allowed four earned runs in just four innings. Despite the offensive efforts from Harris II and Olson, the Braves could not keep pace with the Pirates' scoring. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Michael Harris II hit a home run and contributed two hits, showcasing his power at the plate. 2. Matt Olson also added a home run, but the Braves' offense struggled to generate consistent runs. 3. The Pirates out-hit the Braves 14 to 8, which played a significant role in their victory.
